page.title: 15EMPLOYMENT in GLAMIS
page.content: Up to a generation ago, almost all the people resident in the Glamis area were employed locally. There were many married farm servants or "cottars" and single men in "bothies". The Glamis Estate employed gardeners, gamekeepers, foresters, and handymen. There was a bakers, plumbers, blacksmiths, a carpenters shop and a builders yard. Since then, mechanisation has drastically reduced the farm labour force, and economic factors have reduced the Estate staff. There are still a number of small businesses in the area, and these may have even increased recently. However, the area is increasingly a dormitory for commuters working in Dundee and Forfar. Among school leavers there is little prospect of local employment.
